intro: Picris sinuata, commonly known as the Sinuous Groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed and often have a wavy margin, while the upper leaves are more linear. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and waste areas.
